  • vfricou.system.linux_accounts role – Manage accounts on GNU/Linux systems

vfricou.system.linux_accounts role – Manage accounts on GNU/Linux systems

Note

This role is part of the vfricou.system collection (version 1.0.0).

It is not included in ansible-core. To check whether it is installed, run ansible-galaxy collection list.

To install it use: ansible-galaxy collection install vfricou.system.

To use it in a playbook, specify: vfricou.system.linux_accounts.

  • Entry point main – Manage accounts on GNU/Linux systems

    • Synopsis

    • Parameters

    • Examples

    • Authors

Entry point main – Manage accounts on GNU/Linux systems

Synopsis

  • Manage Linux accounts

  • Autogenerate password if not provided

  • Deploy SSH public keys to users

Parameters

Parameter

Comments

linux_accounts_list

list / elements=dictionary / required

Users specifications list

comment

string

User description (GECOS)

force_passwd_change

boolean

Force user password update

Choices:

  • false

  • true

groups

list / elements=string

Additionnal user groups

home

string

User home path

Default: "/home/<name>"

name

string / required

User name

pass

string

User password

Must defined for types plain and encrypted

pass_type

string

User password type

Choices:

  • "plain"

  • "encrypted"

  • "autogen"

  • "passphrase"

  • "locked"

passphrase_params

list / elements=string

Passphrase format settings

Order is mandatory

Order

min_length: Minimum word length

max_length: Maximum word length

numwords: Word count for passphrase

delimiter: Delimiters

case: Case format

Refer to community.general.random_string

Default: [5, 8, 6, "-", "capitalize"]

shell

string

User login shell

Choices:

  • "/usr/bin/bash" ← (default)

  • "/bin/bash"

  • "/usr/bin/zsh"

  • "/bin/zsh"

  • "/usr/bin/false"

  • "/bin/false"

  • "/usr/sbin/nologin"

  • "/sbin/nologin"

ssh_keys

list / elements=dictionary

User SSH public keys to deploy

content

string / required

SSH public key

opts

string

SSH public key options

state

string / required

SSH public key status

Choices:

  • "present"

  • "absent"

state

string

User state

Choices:

  • "present" ← (default)

  • "absent"

system

boolean

Define system account

Choices:

  • false ← (default)

  • true

linux_accounts_no_log

boolean

No log directive

Choices:

  • false

  • true ← (default)

Examples

# Create user with autogen password
linux_accounts_list:
  - name: ansible
    comment: 'Ansible remote user'
    state: 'present'
    pass_type: 'autogen'

# Create user with autogen password, add it to group and public ssh authorized keys
linux_accounts_list:
  - name: ansible
    comment: 'Ansible remote user'
    state: 'present'
    pass_type: 'autogen'
    groups:
      - <group1>
      - <group2>
    ssh_keys:
      - content: '<public_ssh_key_content>'
        state: 'present'

# Create system user with password lock and add ssh authorized keys
linux_accounts_list:
  - name: ansible
    comment: 'Ansible remote user'
    state: 'present'
    system: true
    pass_type: 'locked'
    ssh_keys:
      - content: '<public_ssh_key_content>'
        state: 'present'

# Remove user account (automaticaly delete home directory)
linux_accounts_list:
  - name: ansible
    state: 'absent'
